Package core.modAPI

Interface CreaturePeripheral

  • public interface CreaturePeripheral
    Implementing this interface is a way to add sensory organs to the creatures
    Note: this interface will never have a initFromParents() method. If you want your peripheral to be impacted by this creature's parents', consider using a creature attribute to inform your peripheral. Creature attributes do have inheritance
    Author:
    clay

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getInputNames()
      This method should always return the same values.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> getInputValues​(Creature c, Board b, double timeStep)
      Updating the peripheral should also happen here.
      void init()
      This should do everything your constructor would normally do.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init()
        This should do everything your constructor would normally do. Expect this method to be called before creature's brain or attributes are initialized.

      • getInputNames

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getInputNames()
        This method should always return the same values. I would've declared it static if interfaces supported static abstract methods.
        Returns:
        a list of all brain inputs that this peripheral will supply the values of (you are encouraged to make up your own input names, rather than use inputs that already exist)

      • getInputValues

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> getInputValues​(Creature c,
                                                                      Board b,
                                                                      double timeStep)
        Updating the peripheral should also happen here.
        Parameters:
        c - the creature that this peripheral object belongs to
        b - the board that c lives on
        timeStep - again, not sure what this is, but Eyestalks in the Evolvio Original mod needed it
        Returns:
        every string returned by getInputNames() should have an entry in this map. There should be no other entries in this map
